reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night prior to a cruise. Good room facing front of hotel. Underground car parking (bit tricky to find) easily missed as hotel is in middle of busy roundabout.
reviews.title: Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room clean & tidy served it's purpose for the night.
reviews.title: Clean Basic Functional and Cheap

reviews.text: Just had coffee/juice & toast in the morning as heading for the cruise.
reviews.title: Cold, dreadful hotel

reviews.text: Very popular hotel with cruise passengers and business people.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem we had was on arrival back at our room after a late night out and drinks in the bar the door keycard would not allow us into our rooms (with friends) which involved the men having to go back to reception to get the night porter up to sort it out. All this took about 30 mins when all we wanted to do was get to bed.
reviews.title: Nothing that bad

reviews.text: I spent 2 nights here on a business trip. The restaurant is cold and characterless, and the service was abrupt at best - I felt like I was a hindrance to the staff member. Fine, i won't eat dinner here tomorrow night, I thought. (My colleague who did had a 1.5 hour wait over a 3 course meal).
reviews.title: Cold Shower

reviews.text: Next morning, I found the shower a bit of a challenge. I got in and shampoo on, the water pressure just died. I had 2 choices - a cold shower with some semblance of pressure, or to run around under the dribble of hot water till the shampoo washed off. Not great. Pressure ebbed and flowed, but never achieved a good enough flow to enjoy the shower. Ok - breakfast. There are 2 coffee/hot water machines. One was out of order for coffee - the other one wasn't working at all. I told a staff member who told me "they should be working". I agreed, they SHOULD be but they are not. It took a quite forceful exchange to get some coffee and tea out for the guests at 7.30am - peak business breakfast time. I went to reception on my way to work to advise about both sets of problems. The receptionist took details and gave a vague apology. I thought when I got back from work I'd find some kind of explanation/apology note from the manager in my room. There was nothing. They hadn't even cleared my dirty coffee cup (after I had to make my own).
reviews.title: Ideal location and good value

reviews.text: The worst was yet to come - another shower exactly like the day before so they had clearly ignored my complaint. I accept that this is a cheapish hotel in a good location, and reasonably clean, but frankly, I work for a massive business, this was booked through the business and I will be advising ALL of my colleagues to avoid. Do they not realise that as a Customer Experience Professional, and valuable customer, I expect a basic service? I will not stay again despite the fact it is literally next door to my office in Southampton.
reviews.title: Basic, Clean & Good Value

reviews.text: This is the third time I have stayed in this hotel. We booked for last Saturday night as part of a Group of 8 couples celebrating 2 birthdays. We parked in the underground NCP early on Saturday afternoon then went off to the football at St Marys. Before and after the match we had a few drinks in the nearby weatherspoons. We have used the hotel bar before which was fine but the selection of beers and the prices are far better at Weatherspoons.
reviews.title: Shocking food

reviews.text: We checked in early evening and this process was speedy and efficient.
reviews.title: Strange, but convenient, location

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights on business for 67 per night. Three star hotel and you get what you pay slightly too much for. If the car park was included it would be decent value. Two star breakfast buffet in a one star breakfast room. Staff on reception good. Drinks are half the price in nearby pubs. They rely on our laziness to buy their very expensive beer.
reviews.title: Okay for business trip.

reviews.text: Basically a premier inn with a cafe and bar. Fine for business but would not use for pleasure.
reviews.title: Good staff and location, mediocre facilities for price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a night here on business and staff provided efficient service on reception and in bar and the room and bathroom were clean
reviews.title: Good basic hotel

reviews.text: However the lack of things like a bathrobe for the price of £84 B&B or shoecleaning kit in the room and such services that one obtains for similar price leaves this guest assessing Jurys Inn as an average hotel for higher end cost in the area.Plumbing noises and air conditioning hum could annoy lighter sleepers. Bath towels were worn and small - not expecting a bath sheet but a decent bath towel is a reasonable expectation.
reviews.title: Served its purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet cooked breakfast was acceptable with food kept adequately hot and staff on hand to assist.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: This was a one night stop before going on a cruise. Although the reception, bar and dining areas are fairly modern (but completely souless) when I entered the bedroom it was like stepping back in time to the 70's or 80's. Basic is the best word to describe the room but it was clean and for one night perfectly adequate if all you want to do is sleep. If I had been staying on business, however, I would have been disappointed because the desk/dressing table was small and not really conducive to working and I also think it would have felt quite claustrophobic being in the room after an hour or so. The strongest feature of this hotel is that the location is pretty good as it is in a central location with an easy walk through a nice park to the main shopping area. Price was reasonable.
reviews.title: Despite the modern exterior the room was dated

reviews.text: Stayed with work for one night. Effecient check in with quick if not friendly staff. Room was basic but functional, bathroom cleanliness needed more attention. Several hairs in the bath etc. Had an issue with hot water in the shower- it was lacking to day the least. Overall for one night it was ok but any longer and I'd expect more.
reviews.title: Basic and does the job

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights at a rate of £47 per room per night without breakfast.
reviews.title: Good points outweighed by bad points

reviews.text: The welcome was excellent; the member of staff that checked us in (Jess) was helpful, smiley and polite.
reviews.title: Stay here if you never need to shower!

reviews.text: The location is good as it's not too far to walk to the city centre. The parking (under the hotel) was easy to find and there were plenty of spaces. Parking is £6 per 24 hours if you get the hotel to validate your ticket (tip: if you intend to stay parked for some time after checkout, don't get your parking ticket validated until just before you leave - this will allow you to claim the concession rate for the full parking period).
reviews.title: Not the best place I have stayed in
